newsitem.title: KUWAIT: Kuwait minister to tour Moslem states over Iraq.
newsitem.headline: Kuwait minister to tour Moslem states over Iraq.

text.p: A Kuwaiti minister flew to Iran on Monday at the start of a four-nation tour to rally support in its latest confrontation with Iraq.
Communications, Electricity and Water Minister Jassem al-Oun will also visit Lebanon, Libya and non-Arab Turkey to discuss "Iraqi threats," the official Kuwait News Agency (KUNA) said.

Libya and Iran, the Gulf region's dominant non-Arab power, oppose U.S. forces being in the area while Ankara has said it would not let NATO ally Washington use its bases for fresh attacks against Iraq.
But Kuwait has invited 3,000 U.S. ground troops to boost its defences and allowed eight U.S. Stealth bombers to operate from the tiny Gulf Arab state.
Oun will hand messages to the leaders of the four states from Emir Sheikh Jaber al-Ahmad al-Sabah on "arrangements and precautions taken by Kuwait to preserve its security and stability," KUNA said.
Other senior Kuwaiti officials have already visited several 1991 Gulf War Arab allies and Russia to explain Kuwait's stand and the need for the U.S. military buildup in the Gulf.
